Allow All enables both movement types. Note that you can also move the camera using the Arrow Keys.

A faithful reproduction of Sophia Bright's crest. The original remains firmly stuck inside its socket.
Sell 40 Drama books in a day.
Sell 20 Drama books in a day.
Did you know that a daisy is actually multiple smaller flowers appearing as one?
This tragic debut novel will leave you feeling empty and haunted, but loving it. A contemporary tale of the meaning of life, love, and death.
This original bucket list contains a wide variety of stunning places around the globe! A must-have in every globetrotter's library, even if it's purely aspirational.
This thrilling first book in the Women's Murder Club series takes four crime-solving friends through a classic murder mystery. Will they make it through the twists this case has in store for them?

The 2nd volume in the ASOIAF series continues to deliver the most heart-wrenching twists and tragedies of medieval fantasy: mysteries of parentage, magic, murder, war, and epic adventures all throughout the lands of Westeros.
A collection of Saint Bookston's greatest works of poetry, including Ashen Grey, Prometheus' Regrets, and Last Breaths.
Get ready for a sexy, epic and twisting book two in the ACOTAR series, where the immortal drama of the fae unfolds around haunted protagonist Feyre. Will she find the right side to stand with?

Who would have thought that the fifth tome in the ASOIAF series has even more dragons, complex politics, and mysterious betrayals in store for us than ever before? Also, George, if you read this: Winds of Winter when?!
An interstellar trade conflict unfolds between two rivalling powers in this epic and thought-provoking sci-fi prequel. A dramatic modern classic of speculative sci-fi!
I've heard the 1740s were a good decade for the English language. Check out lots of words and their meanings in this slightly outdated collection.

The war for the Iron Throne seems to have burned itself out to a truce... for now. But it wouldn't be A Song of Ice and Fire without some deceit, ambitious plotting, power struggles, and mysterious sorcery at work.
Buckle up for an epic space adventure that kicks off the Zones of Thought series and introduces a mind-bending future thousands of years from now.
Stern lords, ambitious ladies, rising queens, and underestimated bastards. This book kicks off an epic fantasy saga full of tragedy, twists, and undead. Winter is coming, and so is the drama!

Everyone in her small town believes the case to be solved. But when young Pippa starts digging up the details of a murder from years past for her final school project, she discovers secrets yet untold.

Simple love triangles are for beginners. In this classic play, romantic entanglements involve four young, love-sick Greeks, fae royalty, enchantment spells, and a donkey, resulting in a comedy for the ages.

In a beautifully futuristic world running on solar power and mutual aid, our protagonist, Dex, lives a very fulfilling life as a monk. Still, something is missing in their life, and something calls them on a journey into the wilderness.

This classic piece by Virginia Woolf is both a thought-provoking essay and a narrative exploration of the position of women as characters, as well as writers, in a literary tradition dominated by the patriarchy.

A timeless family drama by the brilliant Bookston. The three sons of a rich merchant family are vying for their powerful mother's approval. Will their quest for the matriarch's position be worth the destruction they sow on their ways to the top?

From atoms to galaxies, this popular science book takes readers on a wild journey through the past, uncovering the secrets of our fascinating universe. For all of those readers out there who are interested in nearly everything.
War still wages in the Seven Kingdoms, the lands of the ASOIAF fantasy series. Alliances are made just as quickly as they are broken. And don't even get me started on the weddings.
In this first appearance of the eccentric detective Sherlock Holmes and his partner Dr Watson, the pair take out the old magnifying glass to solve a murder case in Victorian London.
In this tragic legal drama by John Grisham, set in a fictional county of 1980s Mississippi, the young attorney Jake Brigance attempts to let justice prevail even in a world full of racial injustice.

The tale of two men in their forties, with countless blisters and a questionable map, on the Appalachian Trail. Get to know the area's history, ecology, and people in this hilarious exploration of the great outdoors.
This "science fantasy" adventure starts off the classic Time Quintet series where three young heroes travel through time and space and face matters of good and evil.
Grammar is entirely made up! It can't hurt you! But, since most of us have to practise it anyway, why not make it fun with this early nineteenth-century American school guide?
Join the escapades of a free-spirited wanderer as they navigate love, self-discovery, and countless adventures in this captivating memoir.
Usually, death precedes a funeral. But with this English family, things go awry quickly, and only Detective Poirot can help them find out who <s>dun</s> did it now.
In this narrativised version of a historical murder case, a young woman's crimes come into question when she is released from prison. Is Grace Marks really a killer?
Follow a curious girl as she tumbles down the rabbit hole, into a world filled with talking animals and puzzling adventures. A classic tale of nonsense and whimsy, illustrated by John Tenniel.
Sometimes, a happy ending can be a woman getting the man she wanted, even if he's generally quite unpleasant. Shakespearean drama and confusion as it should be.
Get to know the Finnish design master Alvar Aalto, as this book takes us on a visual journey through almost sixty years of iconic creations, including photographs, plans, and sketches.

American Psycho details the increasingly dark and violent stream-of-consciousness of a young, rich, narcissistic yuppie working on Wall Street in 90s Manhattan. Contains graphic descriptions of gore and violence.

This comic is many things: a charming travel memoir about a trip through Europe, a lighthearted advice book for anyone with travel anxieties, and a book full of beautiful illustrations of cute kittens and delicious food.
Discover the secrets of Georgetown in this fun and beautifully illustrated guide. Explore its history, indulge in local cuisine, and soak up the vibrant lifestyle.

What happens when all of the planet's intellectuals are shut off from the rest of the world, left to ponder existence without ever experiencing it? Find out in this epic and ambitious sci-fi page-turner.

The first in a series of thrilling mystery novels, Angels & Demons entails an elaborate assassination plot on high-ranking Vatican officials. But what did the mysterious Illuminati have to do with it all?

The allegorical tale of anthropomorphic farm animals, who overthrow the farmer's rule over them and attempt to lead the farm themselves. It is one of the most important pieces of 20th-century political satire, asking: What happens after the revolution?
Anne of Green Gables is the redheaded and feisty orphan girl you can't help but love! This charming children's classic is beloved by readers of all ages around the world.

Why has every previous expedition into Area X ended in a horrible tragedy? And what actually hides inside the contaminated zone? Four scientists are sent to find out in this first volume of a tense cosmic horror trilogy.
From the Renaissance to Neoclassicism, this guide charts the development of English architectural theory and practice, alongside marvellous colour photographs by A.F. Kersting.
A collection of poems, some tender, some despairing, some nihilistic, and so much more. Written in the last three years before Plath's death and published posthumously.
When an eccentric Englishman's unwavering punctuality is questioned, he wagers that he can circumnavigate the world in only 80 days, and we follow his almost impossible journey.
When criminally inclined teenager Artemis tries to restore his family's fortune, he accidentally messes with the wrong fairies. Suddenly, he finds himself amidst a folk of high-tech fae.
The finale to the Good Girl's Guide to Murder YA series and a catching mystery for any true crime podcast fans out there. Will our titular Good Girl make it out unscathed?
The Hollow Earth sci-fi novel for anyone who read 1864's Journey to the Centre of the Earth and thought: "Not enough dinosaurs!"

Eren Yeager has sworn to take revenge on the giant humanoid creatures known as Titans, who destroyed his home and killed his mother. An action-packed and thrilling first volume of the dystopian fantasy manga.
This novel explores an alternate-reality British Empire, in which languages and their meanings are harnessed for their immense magical power.
In this heartwarming and thought-provoking story, a cosy cafe in Tokyo has a mysterious twist... Can you change the past, or will the coffee get cold before you do?
An unrivalled piece of gothic historical fiction by Toni Morrison, a master of magical realism. Beloved tells a story about the trauma of slavery and how past hurt can linger like a ghost.
An Old English epos that still puzzles scholars to this day. Who can we credit for this poetic tale of a Scandinavian folk hero? When was it written? And how much does it tell us about our history?
Liz is on a quest for a teen love story like in the movies. Can her annoying neighbour Wes really help her go to prom with her crush? And why does he have to be so attractive?

After the success of previous short stories, the Polish fantasy series now takes off into its first novel, wherein the magically gifted Ciri must flee from her war-torn home, and comes under the protection of Geralt of Rivia.
Want to impress your friends and family with this great plant identification party trick? This book covers more than 100 plant families and how to spot their common features. Become a botany expert!
Join this charming and colourful journey across Spain with Amerigo Marchesi as they hop on trains, capture stunning vistas and uncover fascinating hidden gems.
Their big age gap seems to be unable to deter Elio and Oliver from their obsession with each other, and they experience the highs and lows of a gay summer romance in 1980s Italy.
The lesbian vampire story you didn't know you needed! This classic gothic horror novel details young Laura's encounter with a new guest at her father's castle, a young woman named Carmilla.

A classic of dark teen horror. High schooler Carrie White is mercilessly bullied by her peers and abused by her religious mother. But when an especially cruel prank is used to humiliate her, her latent telekinetic powers know no bounds.
Cat's Eye tells the tale of a woman's art, memory, and a childhood friendship gone awry. How can she come to terms with her past?
Reel in this absolute catch of a book, because Carpum's fishing trip is something special! Weaving together carp facts, personal philosophy, and globetrotting tales, the author shares all his wisdom.

The cycle established in the dystopian society of Panem continues. The brutal Hunger Games are held again, and traumatised Katniss and Peeta get no choice but to play along, and fight not only for their survival, but also for a revolution...
Only five lucky winners of a golden ticket will be allowed to discover the true goings-on in Willy Wonka's magical chocolate factory. Join them in this illustrated children's tale.
When a clever spider and a radiant pig become friends, what could stand in their way? A charming children's classic with beautiful illustrations.
An essential guide for all students looking to expand their knowledge of the sciences. This classic textbook contains all the essentials to begin understanding the squishiest of all sciences.
You might know her story already, as Odysseus tells it. But in this modern retelling of Greek mythology, the tale of the sorceress on her island gains a whole new depth.

An assassin going by the codename "Villanelle" has recently appeared on the map, killing some of the most influential men in international politics. Can former MI6 agent Eve find and catch this eccentric psychopath?
One of the most important Welsh poets of the 20th century, Thomas' writing is lauded for its strong imagery and thought-provoking depths. Recommended reading for the seaside!
As Auburn is trying to rebuild her life, she is instantly smitten with the mysterious artist Owen. But can their relationship last as his past is revealed? A suspenseful adult romance unfolds.

Sometimes, our lives just don't leave space for cooking. Or do they? These delicious recipes work for all kinds of situations, whether you need last-minute inspiration, only have one clean pot, or can't easily chop ingredients.

Most people like having visual aids in their recipes. But this book takes illustrated cooking to the next level! Enjoy this colourful and fun guide to Korean cuisine, and make cooking new recipes more fun than ever.
Poverty and guilt drive a bright young man to a dark deed. How will he grapple with the consequences of his crime?
A thrilling action plot unfolds when ordinary physics professor Jason is abducted and finds himself in a parallel world. What dark paths will he face to make it back to his old life?
Little Libby's life in rural Kansas is forever changed when she witnesses the murder of her family. Twenty-four years later, she revisits it all for the entertainment of crime-loving strangers.
When the power over life and death falls into the hands of Light Yagami, the young student vows to use it for good. But death god Ryuk might have other plans.
Detective Poirot is keeping to the background on his Egyptian vacation to carefully observe the mystery unfolding before him. Everyone had a motive, but who is cold-blooded enough to be the killer?
A collection of over 90 prehistoric plants and animals, stunningly illustrated by Angela Rizza and Daniel Long. In this remarkable guide, readers of all ages may find their new favourite fossil!
Join Peter Spinner as he looks for the well-kept hidden gems of the enchanting Greater Bookston Region. High-quality restaurants, cosy stays, endearing shops, and local events await!
In a post-apocalyptic Chicago, sixteen-year-old Tris is left with no choice but to join one of five factions. Prepare for an action-packed, dystopian story for young adult readers.
A mad "knight" embarks on hilarious adventures with his faithful, not-so-bright sidekick in this classic satire.
An entertaining yet educational travelogue exploring a Sunburned Country, also known as Australia. Marvel about the country's people, history, landscape, flora and fauna.
A chilling classic that masterfully mixes the 19th-century epistolary novel with early gothic horror. It follows boring businessman Jonathan Harker on a trip to a certain Transylvanian castle...

The most energetic and funny adventure awaits young manga fans in this classic series. Join the super-strong Goku on a fantastical quest for the seven Dragon Balls that have the power to grant wishes!
Menolly can't stay in her fishing village, which forbids her dreams and confines her to rigid gender roles. Surprisingly, the new life awaiting her holds songs and dragons in store.
An epic saga of intergalactic politics and precious resources, where one young man finds himself surrounded by inhospitable desert, and at the centre of a messianic prophecy.
In this comedy of manners from Austen, socialite Emma is very confident in her matchmaking skills. But when will she learn that not everyone appreciates her meddling?
Discover a treasure trove of knowledge in this captivating encyclopaedia! From A as in Academia to C as in Crime, learn more about what makes the world of books go round.
Get ready for a mind-blowing journey through the wondrous world of knowledge! Volume 2 of Encyclopaedia Bookstonia: from D as in Detective Novels to J as in Japanese Manga.
Discover a world of knowledge and adventure in this thrilling third volume of Encyclopaedia Bookstonia. From K as in Knitting Instructions to O as in Omegaverse.
Another epic volume filled with knowledge and wonder! What else does this encyclopaedia series have in store? I'll tell you: Entries from P as in Philosophy to T as in True Crime.
Vol. 5 of this encyclopaedia concludes our journey of learning, with the entries we've all been waiting for: U as in Unfinished Manuscripts to Y as in Yuri. (They forgot to print Z).

They can make us healthy, make us sick, make us drunk or high, or grow on our graves once we are gone. Merlin Sheldrake (what a great name) lets us in on the secrets of the fungi, the coolest lifeform on Earth.

When Ryo becomes a detective in New York, he is partnered up with the American Dee, who soon reveals his feelings for Ryo. Fake is a lighthearted romantic comedy series for all BL manga fans with 90s nostalgia.
A clever fox and his family set out to outsmart their farming neighbours in this charmingly illustrated classic children's novel.
In this work, Professor Alison Kafer proposes a critical framework that imagines another future for disabled and queer bodies and rejects the idea of disability as a predetermined limit.

Liliane Renaud believes that, despite everything, the future must be bright. This solarpunk-inspired work is packed with thoughtful poems and practical insights to guide you through life's most difficult challenges.
Finally, an even more historical fantasy novel, from the world of Ice and Fire. Wherein all the messy relationships, wars, and secrets of the royal Targaryen dynasty are aired out.
A childhood adventure with five friends, a shipwreck, and a hidden treasure. The first in the classic Famous Five series of children's mystery novels.
A collection of fairy stories and poems, Flower Fables is a charming and delightful book, illustrated and easy to read for children and adults of any age.
A science-fiction short story turned novel, which grapples with the meaning of intelligence, disability, and the consequences of human augmentation in the name of progress.
From prairie houses to the Guggenheim museum, this architect had range! This wonderful coffee table book is jam-packed with sketches and photographs for all architecture enjoyers.
Oh, to be 18 again, and write a masterpiece over a particularly cold and dark summer holiday, unknowingly laying the very foundation of our modern horror fiction. Wish that were me.
Oh, to garden, bike, and go on adventures with your soulmate! While these short stories might strictly qualify as children's literature, who doesn't yearn for the life of Frog and Toad?
Four chilling and devastating novellas by Stephen King, dealing with the darkness of retribution and revenge. True horror, read with care!
The must-read primer for anyone seeking to become a serious games scholar.
Unearth the secrets of the dazzling gemstones in this sparkling study of gemology. A challenging academic text from an expert of the field.
Prepare to be chilled to the bone as you journey into the realm of the supernatural with this collection of eerie and haunting tales. With Dickens, Stoker, Wilde, and Poe, as well as new stories.
Following the blossoming relationship of Nick and Amy, we flash forward to their fifth wedding anniversary, where Amy has suddenly disappeared... Has Nick become a man capable of killing his wife?
Student investigator turned podcaster Pippa is trying to leave her detective days behind. But how can she ignore this recent disappearance, when the police won't even investigate?
When the zookeeper isn't looking, this little gorilla isn't the only animal who sneaks out of the zoo. A short and sweet bedtime story for the little ones.
A classic Dickens! Poverty, morality, smelly cities, and unjust austerity measures lead to a rags-to-riches extravaganza with a lot of heartbreak on the way. Oh, right, I forgot orphans.
Gregor discovers a hidden world beneath New York City in this charming, yet dangerous fantasy adventure for young readers. Will he live up to the prophecy foretelling his deeds?

If you're looking to get into the Discworld series, this 8th tale is the one to start with. (There's a lot of them!) Adventure awaits the magical lands of Ankh-Morpork, when a long-lost "noble" dragon suddenly returns and is promptly crowned King.
Through the various travels of Gulliver, this proto-science fiction novel satirises the political environment of England and the travelogues popular during its colonial expansions.
Get ready to enter the digital world with this 90s guide to HTML (specifically 3.2), the language that powers the internet. Let's say "Hello, World!"

This Danish prince suddenly has a lot going on. His father is dead, his uncle is evil, and his mother is quickly getting remarried... So, it is entirely understandable that Hamlet now plunges into a crisis.
Book-inspired recipes! Need I say more? When bestselling romance authors team up with chefs to create their own dishes, you might be in for a treat! Try it at home!
Queen Lili'uokalani was the last reigning monarch of Hawai'i, before the kingdom was overthrown and annexed as a territory of the United States of America. A unique and informative autobiography.
The heartwarming graphic novel where Nick and Charlie meet at a grammar school for boys. Prepare to giggle and blush while watching sparks unfold between them!
The heartwarming story of little Heidi, who lives with her grandfather in the Swiss Alps, changing the lives of those around her for the better. A classic for children all around the world.
The classic textbook for everyone's favourite subject in school! Packed with all the greatest hits like arithmetic, trigonometry, and stochastics.
Shakespeare's next Henry must prove his might in a war against France in this dramatic retelling of English history. And he's certainly nailing the speeches!
Watch as personal squabbles, petty jealousy and Joan of Arc tear apart the English political system in this first part of Shakespeare's King Henry VI trilogy.
This final part of Shakespeare's King Henry VI trilogy focuses on the horrors that ensued during the Wars of the Roses as the nation is thrown into chaos and morality makes way for revenge.
Get ready to brew up some magic as Star Ravenhunt shares the secrets of herbcraft, from natural healing potions to delicious recipes to mischievous hexes.
Get lost and find yourself amidst the stunning natural beauty of Bookston Bay's secret hiking trails. Stunning coastal vistas await around every corner!
This in-depth exploration of the Danelaw by a scholar of history promises sophisticated insights for anyone with an interest in 886–1066 AD in Northern England.
An exceptionally observant, vivid, and often witty journalistic work turned memoir by George Orwell, wherein he tells of his time fighting fascists in the Spanish Civil War.

Stephen is a fan of castles, and he always manages to visit one wherever he travels. On his effective quest to see the most castles in only one week, Stephen compares the Czech Republic, Thuringia, and Wales in this hilarious travelogue.
Sophie seeks out the mysterious wizard Howl, and his ever-moving castle, since he might be her only chance of breaking her enchantment. Is there more to his heartlessness than meets the eye?
There are nice poems, and then there are those tried by the law in an obscenity trial: Radical, honest, political, soft, holy. And life-changing. I much prefer the latter category.

A romantic reinterpretation of the Illiad. Hélène, a 16th-century version of Helen of Troy, has the chance to forever change the trajectory of her life and love. A historical play and a St. Bookston classic for a reason!

This set of nine delightful short stories imagine a world of robot and human colaboration and explores some interesting concepts within this framing. A foundational text of modern Sci-Fi, and a must read in the storebought version of the future we ended up in.
A collection of ancient fragments, this book offers a glimpse into the captivating poetry of a mysterious Greek writer whose verses of passion (for women) have stood the test of time.
A thrilling mystery about a regular woman's descent into a life of crime. Betrayed by love and framed by the mafia, Tracy has to fight back to survive.
Seven acting students at an elite arts college are very familiar with Shakespearean drama. But soon, the fictional power struggles and love entanglements they enact become their reality, too.
Murder, mystery, and chilling psychology intertwine in this pioneering work in the true crime genre, as Capote (and his friend Harper Lee) extensively research a 1959 case.
The newest entry in our In Search Of series: A marvellous view across stunning islands, where paradise awaits at every turn, even if you're on a budget.
The first part of the epic Divine Comedy, and the most famous work of self-insert bible fanfiction to date. Wherein Dante and Virgil delve deep through the nine circles of hell.
Pen and paper can bring characters to life, but what happens when they escape the page? The beginning of a fantastical and dangerous adventure into the world of a book, for all ages.
Explore the mythical and exotic lands of Western Europe. This satirical travelogue lets you in on the secret wisdom and mysterious culture of the West.
This one will certainly make you afraid of clowns, balloons and storm drains... if you aren't already. A staple of small-town horror fiction, It makes children's nightmares a reality.
Sixteen years before her famous novel, The Age of Innocence, Wharton publishes this scholarly travel book. It is a remarkably detailed survey of Italian garden architecture.
This fantastical adventure follows James into a peachy realm populated by friendly worms and bugs. An illustrated book perfect for children.

This intimately narrated story of the winding life of Jane Eyre touches on many social issues present in Victorian England. Her story is frought with twists and hardships but ultimately leads to love.
Explore the fascinating world of French artist, Jean Debuffet. Learn how he strived to thwart conventional standards of beauty in favour of more authentic and humanistic ways of image making.
Have you always wanted to meet a dinosaur? Easy, just hop down an Icelandic volcano and check at the Earth's core. They should hopefully still be there.
A mischievous shapeshifter embarks on a legendary adventure, based on folk tales and legends, in this timeless Chinese classic.

Supernatural strength, cursed objects, and occult research are becoming daily occurrences for Yuji Itadori, the high school outcast protagonist of this popular manga series. A dark adventure for teen readers!
Who's up for a political assassination with the homies? Come on. It's for the good of Rome, right? — No! Wrong! Et tu, Brute?!
Once upon a time... there was the captivating world of fairytales. Discover why these timeless tales continue to enchant and intrigue us in this cultural and anthropological study.
A spirited young witch needs to learn how to stand on her own two feet as she arrives in a bustling and charming seaside town. Sound familiar, anyone?
Spice up your family's kitchen adventures with this delightful guide. From cooking tips to family bonding, discover the recipe for a happy home!
Labyrinths: Selected Stories & Other Writings is a representative selection of essays, short stories, and parables written by Argentine poet Borges and translated into English.
Known as a designer of brutalist buildings, this collection of his projects illustrates Le Corbusier's belief in better living conditions for the increasingly crowded cities of the 20th century.

19th-century Paris. A man running from the law just wants a chance to live his life. Injustice is everywhere. But resistance is brewing, and love is not far. Don't expect anyone to sing, or you'll be disappointed.
The four March sisters navigate love, loss, and the trials of growing up into womanhood, as their coming-of-age story reflects parts of Alcott's own youth.
This chilling page-turner, based on Jones' true story, will take you on a wild journey through the frozen wilderness of Alaska, filled with heartbreak, resilience, and unexpected turns.
Boarding school is not what Miles thought it was gonna be. And neither is that girl he meets, Alaska. Together they search for the meaning behind last words, in this young adult story.
A group of school boys is suddenly stranded on a remote island. Will they manage to survive without any grownups, or will they succumb to their darker instincts?
A contemporary classic by Morrison, which follows three generations of Black women, the aftermath of a man's death, and their complicated relationships to him and each other.
One couple of Scottish aristocrats start to believe that they deserve a bigger piece of the cake. And they decide to make it everyone else's problem...
A Tudor tale of power, betrayal, and queens. Witness the captivating drama and heart-wrenching decisions of a regal Mary, in this loveletter to Shakespearian plays by a legendary German playwright.
A mischievous little genius delights in books and uses her powers to outsmart nasty grown-ups. Will she make it through the school system in one piece?
Woodworking tips and tricks from the days of knights and castles. Unearth ancient techniques and bring medieval craftsmanship back to life!
The captivating story of Meridian Hill, a female activist in the Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s and 70s, and her political and personal revolutions in life.
Discover the awe-inspiring marvels crafted by ancient hands in this fascinating delve into Mesopotamian architecture. Join us on a journey through time!
A charming study of English provincial life, with all of its love, ambition, and scandal. Follow the lives of unforgettable characters in this literary classic.
An obsessive fan has no plans of ever letting her favourite romance author go... Another cocaine-fueled 80s horror classic.
More than just peculiar, these children seem downright supernatural! Follow along this haunting adventure about found family and not fitting in, illustrated with vintage photography.
A maniacal pursuit, an enigmatic white giant, and a captain obsessed with vengeance. A commercial failure, and "the greatest book of the sea ever written", according to Walter.
A strange story of time thieves and a curious child on a mission to return stolen time and joy to her town. Get inspired by this children's classic!
The brilliant surgeon Dr Kenzo Tenma might be the only one who can find out the twisted motivations of a cold and calculating serial killer, in this tense and dark crime thriller in manga form.
A fictional travelogue, self-described as "not anything that can possibly be useful or instructive — but only a sense of what those centuries had to say, and a sympathy with their ways of saying it."

The Moomins are lovable small creatures, invented by the Finnish illustrator, who live a peaceful life in the forest. In the 8th book of the classic children's series, little Moomintroll wakes up during winter hibernation and has to be very brave about it.
An American in Germany turned spy during World War II, is facing trial as a Nazi war criminal. Does the vital role he inadvertently played in the Nazi propaganda machine make him guilty?

Get to know Clarissa as she prepares for a party later that evening. Learn about her life and meet her guests while pondering human nature and exploring the social structures of the 1920s. Will her party be a success?
A web of love, lies and misunderstandings encircle four lovers. Laugh along as their lives get turned upside down in this punny romp about jealousy and trust.
What better place to murder someone than on the world-famous Orient Express? Only the killer forgot that the genius detective Hercule Poirot is also on board.
A very candid memoir in which the author shares her journey with mental health, sexuality, and growing up. A must-read for josei fans!
From Burundi to Uganda, an ageing adventurer shares his eye-opening journey through Eastern Africa, learning life's greatest lessons along the way.
This book is the only physics guide truly written for everyone! Whether you are only months old or already retired, this cheeky picture book might make a genius out of you yet.
No, not the Lucy Dacus song! It's a collection of spooky Stephen King short stories instead. Perfect for enthusiasts of 80s horror.
This collection of poetry courageously explores violence and the delicacy of life. The author tells of the Vietnam War, of his experience with 9/11, and of queer love.
Can love and marriage coexist and is marriage necessary for happiness? Explore love and life in Edwardian London as night and day contrast just as the lives of Katherine and Mary.
Shapeshifter Nimona's plan was to become the sidekick to newly-termed villain Ballister. But when the heroes are not as goodhearted as everyone believed, that plan might have to change last-minute...
A classic of dystopian social science fiction, for good reason. Totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and state oppression of nonconformity - 1984 has got them all.
Follow Connell and Marianne as they grow up in Ireland, fall in love, struggle at school, and navigate their socioeconomic differences in this young romance novel.
A young fangirl of Gothic novels has to learn that dark romance is not always so appealing in real life. A deliciously satirical Austen classic.
After two decades in Britain, this American author isn't afraid to draw his conclusions about the small, weird, lovely island that had become his second home.

This epic manwha series brings a whole new twist on the reverse-isekai trope! Dokja Kim is the only reader of an obscure online novel. So when the dystopic events of the story suddenly occur in real life, he might be the only one who can still rewrite fate!
Follow the increasingly intertwining lives of two very different academic families as their ideologies clash and their struggle with black identity and the nature of beauty unfolds.
A taxonomy of the flora of Bookston Bay from the late 16th century. With hand-drawn illustrations by the polymath Saint Bookston.
When the Breakfast Club turns into a crime scene before detention is over, you know you'll be in for a thrilling, twisted mystery drama.

A medley through over three centuries of history, featuring a suave protagonist and lots of moments of self-discovery. Filled with passionate affairs, bittersweet moments, bending the rules of time, class, and gender.

The heroic black general Othello soon finds himself in the middle of intrigue and betrayal after one fateful promotion. The start of a brutal tragedy about someone who “loved not wisely but too well”.

What awaits Haruhi, the poor girl at an expensive private school, when she suddenly has to work off a debt to some weird all-male after-school club? Well, first of all, she has to dress the part... A quirky and hilarious romance manga for young adults.
In this bittersweet sequel to a YA bestseller, the turbulent romance continues. A gripping story with lots of twists and turns, beautiful moments, betrayals, and a charged game of Assassins.
This memoir details Page's journey of self-discovery, and of overcoming the many hurdles put up by a transphobic and misogynistic film industry, to get to where he is now.
Margo is a mystery in human form, and Quentin would love nothing more than to solve her. The young adult novel for those who are looking to love for the answer.
In a dystopian world ravaged by climate change and corporate greed, a young woman embarks on a biblical journey to spread the seeds of a new religion in an attempt to redeem humanity.
Morrison herself wanted to call this book War. Her groundbreaking novel chronicles the catastrophic happenings taking place in an all-Black Oklahoma town and its counterpart, the Convent.

A visually stunning and bold graphic novel memoir following a young Iranian girl through the 1970s and 1980s. This gripping story explores themes of revolution, religion, family, history and daily life in the face of tumultuous times.
The 27-year-old Anne Elliot gets a second chance at love when her ex-fiance, Captain Frederick Wentworth, moves into her family's home. Another Austen classic that never gets old.
Sometimes, dead is better... Because whatever came back from the grave no longer answers to "Heeere, kitty!". Another horror staple from Maine's biggest fan, Stephen King.
A story about a mischivious boy who becomes stuck "Betwixt-and-Between" childhood and growing up, between the real world and the magical world of Kensington Gardens after dark.
Discover the captivating world of physics through a historical journey that will tickle your brain and transport you to 1908.
In this second installment of the Chronicles of Narnia series our protagonists suddenly return to a changed Narnia, and must help their friends defeat an evil despot making a play for power.
While Italy held many painful memories for Mary Shelley, she returned to the places she had once called home as a political ally in Italy's fight for independence.

All that the teenager Ranma Saotome wants to do is train in martial arts. But a cursed spring queers his pitch, so to speak, because now, every time he is splashed with water, he changes into a girl. The beginning of a sweet and romantic manga series.
Our protagonist is freshly married to a rich manor lord. At her new home, expectations of a carefree married life are shattered when questions about Rebecca, the late lady of the house, arise.
The charming, cheeky, and slightly steamy rom-com where a First Son of America falls in love with a British crown prince, causing chaos, scandal, and plenty of swooning moments.
The first novel in the Hannibal Lecter series introduces us to the infamous psychologist and cannibal, as he finds an unlikely ally in FBI profiler Will Graham. Absolutely gruesome and disturbing!
Shakespeare's classic historical drama about the downfall of King Richard the Second, complete with scheming nobles and history-defining power politics.

The Man Behind the Masterpieces: Explore the life and artistic vision of the legendary sculptor and modern art icon in this series of interviews, presented alongside marvellous black-and-white photographs of his life's work.
No matter how many times you've seen it before, you will always be swept away by the passion and despair of these two lovers. And you might even be surprised by your own emotions.
Join rising Instagram star BrookeTravels on an adventure through Luxembourg as she explores, shares delicious recipes, and provides a refreshing take on travel and lifestyle.

Star Wars meets Game of Thrones! This ninth entry in the Saga series of graphic novels explores fake news and genuine terror in an epic sci-fi setting. Prepare for a heart-warming tale full of tragic twists.

You know her, you love her: Usagi Tsukino might be a bit sensitive and clumsy, but when her friends are in trouble, she turns into THE magical girl and protector of all teenage girls. Join Sailor Moon and her talking cat in her sweet and romantic manga adventures!

According to a reviewer of the play at its original performance, it is "an arrangement in blood and ferocity, morbid, bizarre, repulsive." Now, we might view Salomé as a symbol of modernity, a challenge and a revolt against a patriarchal Victorian society.

A quirky graphic novel about a nonchalant slacker turned romantic hero who must defeat his crush's seven evil exes. It's a pretty clever metaphor for feeling insecure about your new partners romantic past, or so I am told.
Asimov's world-famous sci-fi epic continues as secrets unravel around the 14-year-old Arkady, alliances form in a war for the galaxy, and the true power of the Second Foundation is revealed.

A tale of two sisters, romantic engagements, quarrels, and the difficulty of making sensible and sensual choices in matters of love and marriage of course. Austen's delightful wit and sharp characterizations are great as ever in this all-time classic.
Unravel the enigmatic genius behind Shakespeare's words, as explained by Bill Bryson. A great and light-hearted introduction for every reader interested in the man behind the plays.
The first in a series of young adult novels, set in a dystopian world where one girl's touch is lethal. Will she finally escape the grasp of the government? And will she find love in the meantime?

Shirley is a traditional Brontë romance with a titular intelligent and headstrong heiress. Yet, the novel also deals with themes of economic struggles after the introduction of "labour-saving machinery". Sound familiar, anyone?
A collection of boundary-breaking essays and speeches in which author Audre Lorde negotiates her complex identity as a Black woman, lesbian, poet, activist, cancer survivor, mother, and feminist.
Six of Crows continues the dark YA fantasy series set in the "Grishaverse". Join the criminally talented Kaz Brekker as he gets together a crew of fellow teenage thieves to complete a dangerous task.
From Baum's much lesser known series of children's fantasy, Sky Island takes Trot, Button Bright, and Captain Bill to — you guessed it — an island in the sky. Illustrated by John R. Neill

Billy Pilgrim travels back and forth in time due to his post-war psychological trauma. Vonnegut combines his own experiences as an American soldier in 1945 Dresden with science-fictional elements to create one of the most revered anti-war novels of all time.
Hiro Protagonist (yes, that's really his name) is a hacker and pizza delivery driver in a dystopian, futuristic America. who comes across a very dangerous data file in the Metaverse.

Helen Scales has the perfect name for a marine biologist and wrote the perfect book for all of us who are fascinated by members of the phylum Mollusca. Explore the history of these curious sea creatures with shells.
The most brilliant writer and philosopher of his time. But who was he really? And why do we know so little about his life? Finally uncover the truth in this groundbreaking investigative biography.
It’s a tough galaxy out there, but somebody's gotta live in it, and it might as well be YOU! The brilliant, feminist, sci-fi play turned graphic novel that you may not have heard of yet.
A collection of eight marvellous science-fiction short stories, asking the question that speculative fiction always asks best: "what if?"

Ever dreamt of becoming a teenage spy for MI6 and uncovering a nefarious plot? The plot may be a little ridiculous but you probably won't care as you race along this thrilling first entry in the Alex Rider series.

The story of the friendship between two young Black girls and the conflicting paths that their lives take them on. Read on as their opposing personalities affect the town in a tale about defying social norms, resentment and reconciliation.

Have you ever wondered what people were cooking during the Great Depression? Or did you always want to try a recipe from Ancient Rome? Max Miller was curious about the same thing, and this fun book recreates his viral cooking adventures for the page.

Follow the energetic escapades of young Pippi, the girl with the red braids who lives all alone in her big colourful house with her trusty pet monkey always at her side, and who doesn't listen to what the boring adults have to say.
Join the brilliant detective and his loyal companion on thrilling investigations as they unravel mysteries and outwit criminals in 12 legendary tales.
Turned from a podcast into John Green's first non-fiction book, the writer rates various phenomena of the age of human intervention in nature on a scale of 1 to 5 stars.

Alex-Li Tandem is a mess. He makes his living by selling celebrity autographs, drinks too much, cheats on his girlfriend, and is hunting down an American actress whose last film came out in the 1940s.

When three siblings are suddenly orphaned, they have to live with their strange relative, Count Olaf. The failed actor wants to secure the family fortune for himself, but Violet, Klaus, and Sunny might stop him yet.
Percy Jackson and his friends must enter the Minoan labyrinth to continue their godly quest and fulfil another prophecy in this fourth entry in the Olympian fantasy series.
Esther feels trapped in the confines of womanhood. After struggling with the expectations of marriage, sex, and work, and following multiple suicide attempts, she is hospitalised.
The most heteronormatively masculine, "hard-boiled", noir detective story you'll ever read. In which PI Philip Marlowe uncovers a criminal plot and seduces "damsels" left and right.

Stories within stories intertwine in this gripping tale as Iris Chase looks back on decades of her life. She recalls her childhood, her sister, her failed marriage, a world war... and reveals many secrets along the way.
This Morrison novel does not shy away from dealing with the devastating and harrowing consequences of the violence and abuse that were (and are still) inflicted upon young Black girls.

An open letter to the west, learn all about the Japanese values of Teaism and let them enrich your life. One of the great English tea classics that bridges the gap between the spritual and secular spheres of tea.

Get a glimpse into the most unusual bookshops around the world and fall in love with their proprietor's passion for the trade. I might be biased, but if you ask me, this love letter to weird and wonderful bookshops is only missing one entry (*chrm* yours truly *chrm*).

Twenty-four stories told by twenty-four pilgrims as they travel to Canterbury Cathedral. Who can tell the most enthralling one and win a free meal at the Tabard Inn? This classic piece of English literature has been thought to have popularized the language in mainstream literature, but was it ever finished?
Wilde's first published story is a classic ghost tale with lots of humour. Because what could be more fun than a bold American family moving into an estate haunted by an English aristocrat?
Edgar did it again, a short story whose gruesome nature will linger much longer on your mind.
A striking epistolary novel that continuously insists on the solidarity, friendship, and romantic love between women of colour, even in the face of the greatest adversities.
This play might be less deep than what we are used to from Billy S., but the slapstick, puns, mishaps, and chaos could make any modern audience laugh.
Sixty-two years after the first published instance of the word 'robot', Asimov collects his science-fiction short stories about the industrious automatons in this series.
In this epic tale of revenge, redemption, and exquisite French drama, a betrayed lover returns to the Parisian high society in search of sweet revenge.

Jude is a mortal living in the fae realm and is constantly tormented by the High Court. Worst of all is the youngest prince. But can she stand up to him without being roped into the intrigue of the palace?

Christopher might be only 15, but he notices things that others don't. When his neighbour's dog is suddenly killed, he wants to know what happened. This novel is unique in its use of maps, pictures, and diagrams!
Follow the triumphs and trials of a remarkable family, as the Debvoir clan shapes and is challenged by the very history of Bookstonbury.

Edith Wharton only became a writer at 40, and besides her many novels, she also wrote books on design, travel, and culture. At 60, she was the first woman to win a Pulitzer for Fiction. It is never too late to begin.

Are YOU looking for feminist, anarchist sci-fi? I'm told Le Guin's Hainish Cycle is the place to start. While this book is technically the fifth book in the series, it is also the first in the chronology. Confusing, I know.

London's high society loves Daphne. Yet none of the eligible gentlemen are courting her so far. Can the brooding Duke of Hastings, who has no interest in marriage or society, help her raise her reputation?
The poetry and philosophy of the 13th-century Persian scholar known as Rumi have been among the most influential works in history.
A year after her son's death, Tina begins seeing things... Did Danny really die in an accident? And who is trying to conceal the truth from her? A paranormal horror-thriller.
American Gothic horror at its finest. Much like the guests of House Usher, you will never be quite the same after diving into this deliciously dark and tragic short story.

In the cancer support group her mother made her go to, 16-year-old Hazel meets Augustus. They share a love for books and metaphors and make each other rethink what it means to live, and what it means to die.

An unlikely band of heroes must go on a quest to destroy an evil ring once and for all. Their journey through Tolkien's vibrant fantasy world has become part of the foundation of modern fantasy literature.

It begins as a slow, melancholy tale of two widowed fishermen in upstate New York. But this unusual horror epic quickly turns into a deeply moving and intimate nightmare that will leave you awake at night.

This book must be one of the darkest Nordic crime thrillers out there. Still, Larsson manages to sneak in moments of kindness and allyship that make this brutal revenge epos just barely possible to endure.
Journalist Jeannette Walls recounts her unstable childhood and the fraught relationship with her parents in this bestselling memoir.
The God of Small Things tells the dramatic story of twins from Kerala, India. They recall their childhood in 1969, as they grew up surrounded by family misery, political unrest, and forbidden love.
The glamorous tale of love and wealth that shaped the cultural imagination of "the roaring 1920s". Yet this story doesn't shy away from confronting the unknown dark sides of the "American Dream".
The heart-wrenching story of a death-row inmate with magical abilities. Prepare for a sordid tale of a corrupt and cruel institution and of the mouse that survived it all.

The last gunslinger's treacherous search for his ancient adversary leads him across an alternate reality Old West. A path full of monsters, demons and sacrifice lead to his ultimate destination: The Dark Tower.

A dystopian tale that imagines a totalitarian state in which the majority of women have been stripped of their freedom and reproductive rights to serve a Christian fundamentalist elite of men and their wives.

A charming collection of illustrated children's tales written by the famous Irish playwright. Also includes The Nightingale and the Rose, The Selfish Giant, The Devoted Friend, and The Remarkable Rocket.
In this tense horror classic, a group surrounding an "expert of the occult" are investigating the mysterious Hill House. But inside, they are awaited by more than just spooky poltergeists...
Join the clever teenage detective Nancy Drew as she solves the mystery of a mysterious haunting. A detective story for all ages.
A ticking time-clock threatens to destroy the world. A newbie and a local boy team up to stop the magical doomsday plot. Join them in this illustrated romp full of black magic, ghosts and derring-do.

The twelve districts of Panem are barely held under control. To keep them from revolting, children from each are chosen for gladiator-like games. There can only be one survivor, so Katniss can't let her little sister be picked.
A hilarious and clever tale and a must-read for any fans of the Irish writer. A play that satirises Victorian society, from the author who ruffled many societal feathers.
This thrilling mystery for young adults kicks off a series of novels surrounding Avery, a teenager who suddenly becomes heir to a strange billionaire's fortune. If she can make it that far...

Only 90s kids will remember wanting the ability to spontaneously transform into an animal. But be careful, because aliens are trying to infiltrate Earth and, if you don't change back, you might get stuck as a hawk forever!

A mysterious stranger appears at a village inn, causing chaos with the experiments he hides in his room. When he is discovered to have made himself invisible, a wild chase ensues. A thrilling classic of early science fiction.
It is almost Judgment Day in Narnia. Like, actual Christian Judgment Day. Where Lion Jesus sends all of the good guys to heaven at the end. The metaphor is no longer subtle at all.
A dark and dangerous story about fate, sorcery, and monstrous creatures. Accompany the Witcher, Geralt of Rivia, on his reluctant adventure, where he discovers curses, promises, and lovers.
In this tale of greek mythology, friendship and mediocre paternal figures for the ages, our young protagonist has to go on a mythic roadtrip to retrieve a stolen artifact or face Zeus's wrath.
In this delightful classic siblings stumble upon a magical world through an ordinary wardrobe, where talking animals and a wicked witch await.
An enchanting tale of love, loss and an adventurous little prince who explores the universe and his own feelings. One sees clearly only with the heart. A must read for all ages.
A furry creature speaks for the trees and shows us how capitalism is destroying nature. Don't be fooled by the clever rhymes, this children's book is a razor-sharp critique and hard-hitting warning.
Classic fantasy meets greek mythology in this 1972 retelling of the legend of Atlantis. A heroic warrior priest is all that stands between an avaricious empress and the end of an era.
Once again, symbologist Robert Langdom has to decode the secrets of old to save his mentor. This time in Washington D.C., there are undiscovered mysteries waiting for him.
To convince her friends that she is over her ex, PhD student Olive convinces her young professor Adam to start a fake relationship. An example of fanfiction turned published book at its best.

Out of discontent with his new life, young Philip builds a city out of his toys, books, and game pieces. Next thing he knows, he appears in a life-size version of it, populated with people who need his and Lucy's help.

An emotional yet hopeful YA graphic novel about the son of Vietnamese immigrants. His parents struggle with their English, so how can Tien really talk to them about what he is going through? Will they understand when he tells them he is gay?
This collection contains twelve beautiful and poetic short stories for children, including tales of talking animals, monarchs, fairies and beasts, and magical worlds.
Astro-botanist Mark Watney is left behind on Mars after his crew narrowly escaped a dust storm. Alone and without supplies, the incorrigible optimist has to improvise in order to survive.

This classic sci-fi short-story cycle chronicles the exploration and settlement of Mars by the U.S. in the far and distant future of 2030. Bradbury explores militarism, genocide, oppression, and censorship from his post-war perspective.
Thomas wakes up among other teenagers in the centre of an ever-changing maze without his memories. He soon learns that all they can do to survive is to try and escape by any means necessary.
A quaint village, a nosy vicar and a most sinister murder. Join Miss Marple, the Queen of Crime, on a typical English murder mystery, full of exaggerated characters and dry wit.

This famous whodunnit harbours a twist you might not see coming. As detective Hercule Poirot leaves retirement to review the crime scene, all signs point to a locked room that no one could have gotten into.

A book of many beginnings. The start of Christie's career as a prolific crime novelist. The first appearance of beloved Belgian detective Hercule Poirot. And a first in a long series of brilliant and suspenseful whodunnits.

In this alternate universe, successors of the Throne of England are chosen through random selection. And while the newest king fails to take his position seriously, one inhabitant of Notting Hill upholds his whimsical decisions with vigour.

When a little boy hides in the attic with a strange book, an exciting adventure begins in the book's fantasy world. A story about escapism and imagination for all of us who enjoyed hiding in our books.
A legendary Greek epos about a perilous journey home, with many mythical roadblocks along the way. Good thing, our protagonist is smart as a whip, and nobody is able to stop him.

Charles Darwin's groundbreaking research on natural selection became one of the founding texts of modern biology and science. His discoveries were used to argue against a creationist belief system and created the grounds for a new study of evolution.
The terrifying Outsider stalks Flint City, committing heinous crimes. Tag along a rag-tag team of heroes who take it upon themselves to deal with this nightmare in classic Stephen King fashion.

Written by the author when she was still a teenager herself, this coming-of-age novel is known for dealing with the socio-economic struggles of White American working-class teenagers and the "greaser" gangs they formed.

The test subjects of a virus experiment develop strong physical and psychic abilities which cannot be controlled. The virus is spread and 90 years later, only a few colonies survive. One of them encounters the strange Amy...

Charlie doesn't fit in anywhere at his new school. He grapples with grief and flashbacks to his aunt's death. But two seniors take him under their wing, and Charlie experiences all the joy and despair of growing up.
The Narcissus myth of the Victorian times, Wilde's novel is a wonderfully Gothic exploration of the values of beauty, sensuality, and hedonism in their opposition to morality and social norms.
A comprehensive collection of poetry written by a woman who never received much recognition for her work while she was alive.

Perhaps the origins of cottage core? John Ruskin will take you on a tour of his favourite cottages and villas throughout Europe. Delight in his philosophical musings about the beautiful interplay of nature and architecture.

This epic folk-tale was first composed around 300 BCE and was hugely influential on storytellers of later eras. Discover a modernised version and dive into heroics, battles with demons, and philosophical and spiritual wisdom.
Once upon a dreary midnight, our protagonist is haunted by a raven, in this beautifully painfull poem about love and loss. Warning, it might leave you pondering weak and weary.

The legendary showdown between good and evil, bravery and cowardice, love and doubt in a fantasy world on the brink of collapse. In between it all are some of the most poetic character moments in writing history.

This shojo manga is a historical romance classic. Alongside Marie Antoinette's life at Versailles and the brewing unrest among the French, we follow Lady Oscar, a noblewoman who lives as a man so she can command the palace guard.

With this reference work, it is easier than ever to pick up gardening! Simply follow the guides, made easy with the help of over 3000 photographs, or look up any questions you might have about your plants. Guaranteed green thumb!

Return to the land of Oz and embark on a typically Ozian adventure lined with quirky characters and unlikely scenarios. Join Cap'n Bill, Trot and a magical Scarecrow as they take down dastardly King Krewl.
An incredible insight into the history of our oceans, their influence and power, but also their fragility, written by American marine biologist and conservationist Rachel Carson.
Mythical monsters, cursed cruise ships and unexpected friends accompany our Olympian teenagers in this divine sequel to the fantastic Percy Jackson series.

Finally find out what happened to Zuko's and Azula's mother in this continuation of the animated series! Aang and his friends are once again saddled up on their flying bison and are hurdled straight into another emotional and hilarious adventure.
An insight into the forgotten anecdotes of history, which was hugely popular in 1953 and still makes for an entertaining read. However, most of these historical "theories" have since been disproven.
This historical drama follows Evelyn Hugo, an old Hollywood star, as she prepares her spicy tell-all biography, full of highs and lows, love and tragedies.

This dry essay is a must-read for fans of gothic revival and a fun insight into the minds of 1800s mid-century architects. If you've ever wondered how architects 200 years ago contemplated their craft, this one's for you.

He possesses the only known copy of a mysterious book by an even more mysterious author. Join Daniel on his treacherous journey to uncover the story of the book and its author in this winding neo-gothic novel.
A haunted hotel, a writer with writer's block, his fraught marriage, and the creepiest children in literature. What could possibly go wrong?
A chilling thriller that won't let you go. Follow an FBI trainee as she struggles to cooperate with a cunning and cannibalistic psychopath to catch another serial killer.
A terrifying delve into the twisted mind of Alicia Berenson. What moved her to suddenly murder her husband? And will the search for the truth be too much to bear...
Tolkien finally takes his time to write his own religious scripture about the creation of Middle-earth. Perfect for all closeted fantasy-theologians.

A young Black boy explores his neighbourhood transformed by the magic of snow. The beautiful illustrations of this charming story helped pave the way for more inclusive representation in children's literature.

A marvellous retelling of the timeless classical epos, the Iliad, that focuses on the things that really matter. Complicated parents, the merciless politics of war, and, of course, the greatest love story of them all.

Wilde sharply outlines the economic realities of his time and prescribes humanistic socialism as a cure. What might have been a hot take today was instead published as an essay packed with stellar quotes in 1891.
A guttingly dark exploration of a bioweapon-turned-pandemic wiping out most of humanity, and the struggle of good vs. evil amongst the survivors left in its wake. Not for the faint of heart.
A thoroughly researched exploration of Venitian art and architecture, comprised of three groundbreaking volumes. If you have a soft spot for hard rocks, get this!

This curated anthology chronicles the Stonewall uprisings after fifty years through articles, first accounts, and more. Iconic activists and forgotten revolutionaries, who were indispensable to the gay liberation movement, tell their stories.

In this fantastic gothic horror thriller not everything is as it seems, when a violent madman begins an escalating crime spree in London. As a lawyer begins investigating these mysterious incidents, a brilliant exploration of identities and dark urges ensues.

A sadistic serial killer is on the loose in Boston, and evidence of his surgical skills leads investigator Rizzoli to suspect that he might be a physician. A dark and twisted thriller and the first in the popular Rizzoli & Isles crime series.
Ba-bump, ba-bump, ba-bump. You killed someone and now the investigators are here. Ba-bump, ba-bump, ba-bump. Surely they must hear it, too. How will Poe's delightfully chilling short story end?

In this Shakespearean classic, a wizarding scholar is disposed of by his brother and forced to take a sabbatical on a desolate island. A play full of thundering monologues, magical confusions and romantic distractions.
In this totally real travelogue from the 13th century, we follow the author's self-insert — conveniently named Marco Polo — on his legendary travels from Venice to Beijing.
In this second book in Tolkien's foundational fantasy epic, the forces of evil have not been idle, and so our protagonists see themselves surrounded by evil creatures and poor advisors.
One of the first instances of Martians invading Earth. How will humanity defend itself? A great example of the what if they did to us what we did to others kind of sci-fi horror.
Turns out the brilliant poet and designer William Morris also wrote a Fantasy classic. This beautifully illustrated book follows a young adventurer in an action-packed world of fading magic.
16 heirs must pair up to solve the mystery of eccentric millionaire Sam Westing's last will and testament, all to win his vast fortune. Puzzle along as the twist and turns of this clever case unfold.

This wonderfully twisted gothic horror classic follows two friends on a fateful canoe trip. Scary campsite encounters and weird nature—this otherworldly thriller will make you relieved to be in the comfort of your home.

In Aster's family, boys aren't meant to be witches, they're supposed to grow into shapeshifters. But at 13, Aster still hasn't shifted, and when his friends need help, his fascination with witchcraft might be the only thing that can help. A graphic novel for adventurous middle-grade readers.

The young art teacher Walter Hartright finds himself entangled in a complicated family mystery. Will he find out the underlying secret that led to the tragedy? Be prepared for a twist in this spooky classic.
A collection of some of the most well-known fairytales of European history. The many folktales, from Icelandic to Ukrainian to Estonian to Greek, are translated and edited for all children to enjoy.
Life's expiration date is non-negotiable in this heart-wrenching story of two teenage boys spending their last 24 hours together. A story of love, hope, and death.

Mary is an orphan living at the Thornhill Institute, who tells her story in her diary. Ella, whose story is told through artful comic strips, has just moved into a street with an old, abandoned house... A dark and haunted story fit for young readers!
Follow the worst of the Romans, as he does the worst things in the worst ways possible. An incredibly violent Shakespeare play, not for the faint of heart, filled with revenge, monologues, and pies.
A timeless story of justice and innocence in a small Southern town where a lawyer takes on a charged case amid the prejudices and tensions of Depression-era Alabama.

The Ramsay family spends the summer on the Isle of Skye with a few of their guests. Among them, a young painter observes the tensions and relationships between the family members and how they change 10 years later.
From winding coastal roads to serene mountain retreats, this comprehensive camping guide unveils a collection of breathtaking landscapes and hidden gems.
This polarizing manifesto calls for a new architecture for modern times. A foundational text to understand Corbusier's work, brutalism and mid-century architectural movements.

Have you ever looked at an old city's houses, castles and bridges and asked yourself: "How did they build that"? This book illustrates the greatest building techniques of all time and what we can learn from them today.
A young boy finds himself in the possession of a pirate treasure map in this classic story of treachery and treasure that will have your kids dreaming of becoming a pirate.

What does life look like in total darkness? It's much more busy than you would think! Get to know the most fascinating cave-dwellers: from worms to snails, spiders, crustaceans, insects, fish, amphibians, and even the occasional mammalian visitor!

After being bullied for her appearance in middle school, Jugyeong starts over with a new look. After mastering the art of makeup, none of her new friends know what her face really looks like. The first print of the popular Korean webtoon.
In this steampunk classic, a group of scientists around Captain Nemo unexpectedly embarks on an unforgettable underwater adventure in the Nautilus.
In romance, there is something for everyone. This book is for the crowd who hear "possessive asshole, and her brother's best friend" and swoon.
He doesn't want love, and she doesn't have time for it. Sounds like a perfect arrangement with benefits, right? If only people and their hearts were so simple...

This book shares the author's personal experience with Autistic masking, extensive research on the history of the topic, as well as actionable advice and exercises to encourage self-expression. A ground-breaking work on neurodiversity.

The definitive guide to everything PC-related. Scott really makes it sound easy—a book for PC repair enthusiasts and those who might want to upgrade all the way to an unbelievable 64 megabytes of RAM!

A historical novel set in the Middle Ages, by certified goth nerd Mary Shelley. Mirroring the struggles of women in Shelley's time, the female protagonist must choose between love and political liberty.

Lucy is hired as a governess in Villette, France, where she faces loneliness, illness, friendship, and eventually love. A novel famous for its plot twists, thanks to a narrator who frequently hides information from the readers.
In this thrilling and bloody case, Detective Alex Cross investigates another macabre murder with undeniable signs of vampires while being haunted by someone from his past.

This revolutionary graphic novel uncovers the history of women who fought for their freedom on slave ships and throughout the Americas. It is a powerful exploration of resistance at the intersection of white supremacy and patriarchy.
In the world of Watchmen, superheroes emerged in the 1940s and altered history as we know it with their presence. Tune in for the twelfth and last issue of the iconic comic series.

To come to terms with a new stage in her life, Cassandra explores what that family memory means to her. She carries on a tradition of Black Women's storytelling and history-keeping to contrast her present day with the South in the early 20th century.
This revolutionary book aims to challenge the cultural attitudes and systemic biases behind anti-fatness and calls for a social justice movement that includes fat activism.

As a child, throwing a tantrum is fun and all, until you find yourself in the middle of a group of "wild things". This delightful classic is about the important things, like dancing in the moonlight and missing your mum.

Wizard detective Harry Dresden is back in the 9th instalment of The Dresden Files. His new case takes him into Chicago's seedy underbelly as he tracks a vicious serial killer of magical practitioners.

This postcolonial novel focuses on the friendship of two wartime friends, a Bangladeshi and an Englishman. The story about mixed families, clashing ideologies and activism comes to a dramatic conclusion.

How can Coco ever become a witch if she was born without the gift of magic? Well, a mysterious magician might hold the missing puzzle pieces for her dreams to come true! This popular manga series promises loveable characters and a whole lot of magic.
The devil lurks in the Witch Wood, or so people say. A disappearing minister, a satanic cult and a ravaging plague, but what lies at the bottom of it all? Find out in this Scottish masterpiece.
The only novel Emily Brontë ever wrote, and it's a masterpiece! A haunting tale of love and abuse set amidst the austere Yorkshire moors.

When the 17-year-old Julie loses Sam, the shared future they imagined dies with him and everything changes. All she wants now is to hear his voice again when she calls his phone. And against all odds, it doesn't go to voicemail...
Concrete, light, curves! This coffee table book is packed with some of contemporary architecture's finest works by visionary architect Zaha Hadid.
A poetic journey through heartbreak and healing and the hurt and love that come with 21st-century womanhood.

This heartfelt collection of short stories follows a newcomer to a small coastal town as they find their footing among the many quirky locals.
A grove of ferns? Or is it a bunch? A collective?

Holy St. Bookston! A lot has happened lately, which I can't even begin to fit on one postcard. But here's my attempt:
Met an agent in Berlin. Got to talking, got drunk, went to karaoke together. She calls back two days later with an offer to open for this huge band. In Japan. We flip out. 2 weeks later, we're on a plane. Played on the biggest stage I've ever seen in my life yesterday. Can't stop shaking. Might be a dream.
Hope I can tell you more soon, since we might be coming back home for a little bit.
Lots of love, Klaus

I lost my betrothed at 28 years young. At such youth, and in light of our secret, I felt not the power to speak up when the university claimed her work under the Bookston name. And when the church made a saint of this "Bookston", I could only watch.
With my last power, I gave all that they may not discover our sanctuary here.
Dost thou, in your modern time, dear reader, know the feeling of living with a secret? I hope it isn't so. For then, it may at last be time for her name to be known. Please honour my Sophia.

Yours gratefully,
Audrey Harington-Bright, 1634

Oh, how lucky I am to not have to do it all alone. I have neighbours who carried my shopping inside when I couldn’t. I have friends who asked after me, who accompanied me to appointments, and who commiserated with me about feeling old and useless. I have a community full of people who cared, who maintained my garden for me when I couldn’t, who told me they had had the same surgery and that I didn’t need to worry, and who sent flowers and cards to my room today. It’s hard to put onto the page how grateful I feel for all of them.
— Your friend Tilde

I have memories from years ago, a generation ago, and half a century ago, and yet they are only a short walk apart.
Maryam and I met over fifty years ago and thought we had life all figured out. Five years later, Mary had her son Hal. When she called me, we both cried and cried with joy. Twenty-seven years after that, we got the invitation to Hal’s wedding. And when Moira was born a few years later, that was the first time we felt a little old. Five days ago, Maryam called me with instructions for what to pack for my hospital visit, as if I’d never packed my own bags before.
These memories are not far apart at all. They all live on the same street, waving to each other from their front yards.
— Your friend Tilde

Today, I miss my bookshop more than ever. It was always incredibly fulfilling to be able to provide a welcoming, safe place where people wanted to return to. Whether they bought something or not was never the point. It was never about how many sales I made. And I've never believed in "competition". Whoever walked in just needed a warm place to stay for a while. And often, the books they took home weren't what they were looking for when they came in, but what they needed to go on. Rarely do people talk about their troubles directly. But an open ear, someone who would listen, was often worth more than any words of advice I could have given.
— Your friend Tilde

This setting adjusts the relative resolution of the 3D game world compared to the user interface.
Lowering this value can improve performance on some devices, especially when using higher resolution screens, while keeping the user interface clear and readable.

This setting determines the resolution at which Tiny Bookshop will be displayed.
Higher resolutions provide a clearer image, while being more demanding on your device.
Lower resolutions lead to a blurrier picture overall, while often improving performance on some devices.
In most cases it is preferable to try and keep the resolution as high as possible, and instead lower the 3D Resolution Scaling.
